intro.title: Welcome
intro.content: I am an experiential therapist and collaborative, relationally-oriented counselor who seeks to support individuals within their current context. Rather than providing traditional talk therapy, I integrate practices of mindfulness and experiential approaches to help you work through challenges and discover paths to healing.

about.title: About Me
about.subtitle: Who Am I
about.intro: I am an experiential therapist and collaborative, relationally-oriented counselor who seeks to support individuals within their current context.

promises.title: First Promise
promises.content: Because I am a firm believer that you can only take someone as far as you yourself have gone, I will not ask anything of you that I don't ask of myself. Therefore, every technique used in session or trainings is one that I have not only been trained in but also experienced personally.

promises.title: Second Promise
promises.content: I will not suggest anything that I do not believe will be to your benefit. With that said, I let all my clients know that you always have veto power and all suggestions are invitations.

about.journey: Prior to becoming a Nationally Certified Counselor, I obtained my psychology degree from Hendrix College before moving to Atlanta to attend Emory University's Candler School of Theology and earn my Master of Divinity. I then returned to school to earn my Master's Degree in Clinical Mental Health Counseling at Mercer University.
credentials: Master's Degree in Clinical Mental Health Counseling - Mercer University

approach.title: My Approach
approach.subtitle: Experiential & Integrative Therapy
approach.description: I use experiential modalities to integrate humanistic, existential, and systems theories with cognitive, behavioral, and solution-focused techniques. I seek to work with clients to identify strengths, better utilize available resources, and work through challenges that pose obstacles to fulfilling life and relationships.

faqs.question: What services do you offer?
faqs.answer: I offer Individual Therapy (in person and virtual, 60-120 minutes), Individual/Couples/Family Intensives (1-4 days with 6-8 hours daily), Therapy Groups, Experiential Consultation, Professional Training, and Group Retreats and Workshops.

faqs.question: What are your fees?
faqs.answer: Individual Therapy is $150 per 60-minute session. Intensives range from $1,200-$1,500 per day depending on length. Consultation is $150/hour. Training is $1,500/day. Group costs vary.

faqs.question: Do you take insurance?
faqs.answer: I am a private-pay practice and do not currently accept insurance. However, I can provide a 'super bill' for potential out-of-network reimbursement through your insurance company.

faqs.question: What forms of payment do you accept?
faqs.answer: I use Simple Practice where you can set up billing through a client portal. Accepted payment methods include: Credit/Debit Card, Cash, Check, Venmo, and PayPal.

faqs.question: Do you work with couples or families?
faqs.answer: I work with couples in intensive settings (2-4 day intensives). I offer family sessions in 90-120 minute blocks.

faqs.question: Where are you located?
faqs.answer: My physical office is at 6065 Lake Forrest Drive NW, Suite 250, Sandy Springs, GA 30328. Note: The building requires stairs to access the second floor. For those with mobility issues, virtual sessions and home visits are available.

faqs.question: What is the next step if I have more questions?
faqs.answer: You can schedule a free 15-minute consultation to discuss your needs and see if we're a good fit.
